KUSELAN -RAJNI

Kuselan is a forthcoming bilingual drama being directed by P. Vasu, who with Kuselan, will direct his fifth feature film featuring Rajnikanth. Rajnikanth, playing a guest role, is the one of the few common actors in the bi-lingual, the others including Nayantara and Meena, which is to be made into Tamil as Kuselan and Telugu as Kathanayukudu respectively. Various other regional actors have been signed up for the film, with Pasupathy, Meena, Prabhu Ganesan, Vadivelu, Santhanam and Livingston playing roles in the Tamil version, whilst, Jagapati Babu, Sunil and Brahmanandam portray roles in the Telugu version. Whilst, G. V. Prakash Kumar and Arvind Krishna have confirmed their parts as members of the technical crew. The film which is expected to be released in July 2008, will be produced by prominent director, K. Balachandar for the Tamil version and Ashwini Dutt for its Telugu version. The film is a remake of the Malayalam classic, Kadha Parayumbhol.

KUSELAN SOUNDTRACK

The soundtrack of Kuselan was released on June 30, 2008 at the Le Royal Meredian Hotel and was available for download[15] on the Internet the following day. A grand function was held for the release and was attended by P. Vasu, G. V. Prakash Kumar, Rajinikanth, K. Balachander, A. R. Rahman, Arjun Sarja, and Dhanush. The background score has been composed by G. V. Prakash Kumar along with five melodious songs. Two of the numbers contain lyrics which praise Rajinikanth\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\&#039;s career and another one (Cinema Cinema) commemorates the 75th anniversary of Tamil cinema.

   1. Cinema Cinema - Shankar Mahadevan
   2. Sollamma - Hariharan, Sujatha Mohan, Baby Ranjini & Baby Pooja
   3. Om Zaarare - Daler Mehndi, K. S. Chithra & Sadhana Sargam
   4. Chaaral - Shreya Ghoshal
   5. Perinba - Kailash Kher, V. Prasanna
